I don’t usually answer LinkedIn trolls, but today I will.
“You are a fool”, “You are a waste of time”… and the list goes on.
Friday, this individual kept trolling me. I ignored them, then they started to troll commenters on my post.
Some people say kill them with kindness but I don’t subscribe to this strategy.
I am accustom to the personal attacks. I will not even lower myself to get into an online battle. I let it roll off like water off a duck’s back.
However, I will not tolerate personal attacks to my contacts here who I value and respect. We can agree to disagree however, the name calling is getting out of hand.
Read full post here: "Dealing with Trolls: Don't Feed Them and Don't Be One" - https://lnkd.in/dmFpzQJ
There is a reason trolls live under the bridge, block them and send them back where they belong.
It's about time we bring back professionalism to #LinkedIn
3 workers are working in the forest, cutting trees day in and out.
A passer-by sees that 1st woodcutter is very unhappy, 2nd is ok, 3rd is very happy and working fast.
He asks the first woodcutter, what's going on ?
1st man replies - hard work, boring and tiresome.
He asks the 2nd man the same question.
2nd man say, I am ok, I am making a living, i have a family to feed.
He then asks the 3rd man, the happy one.
The 3rd man says, we are building a beautiful ship. This ship will take us out to a shiny blue sea and to magic lands.
Fill the sails of your employees with the big picture of shiny seas and magic lands.

summary: Career AspirationsI am a young and energetic individual, who has solid experience in the field of Recruitment. I would like to design my career path in such a way to utilize my knowledge along with my creative skills in leadership and inter-personal relationships.SUMMARY:•	Dynamic, result-focused, full life cycle recruitment experienced professional.•	Commit to client service and creative recruitment process.•	Experience in sourcing both Active and Passive candidates using sources like Job Portals, Social Networks, Internal and External Candidate databases, etc.•	Experience in Internet recruiting using sources like Google, Linked-in and Facebook•	Proven track-record of success locating, identifying and closing top candidate talent.•	Build and maintain candidate relationship to ensure a consistent talent pipeline.•	Able to self-manage multiple positions by sourcing, screening, qualifying, coordinating interviews, •	Capable of training fresh minds in recruitment process.•	Proven ability to work independently as well as manage a team.•	Effective Vendor Management and Negotiating skills and constantly building Vendor and Candidate databases
